text: Hello Guys, I am trying to update the contact property(multiple checkbox) (eg. GTW Test) , for that I am using this endpoint: ( <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/update_contact-by-email> ). It gives me 204. But the property is not getting updated. Is there any specific way to update or checked this property value for this particular email id? , So that I don't need to select the options manually.
Are there any APIs for the Advanced Menus to clone them?

We are a Shopify store. We're currently launching a non-Shopify checkout that will handle a portion of our checkouts. This checkout takes place on a different domain from our store.

The HubSpot<>Shopify integration takes care of customer identification when they make a purchase. Shopify identifies the new customer, and all pre-purchase site behavior is tied to the new contact.

Is it ok to identify a new contact on a different domain from the one where the site activity took place? For example, a customer comes to <http://xyz.com|xyz.com> and views several pages. They then checkout through <http://xyzshop.com|xyzshop.com>. If I identify the customer on <http://xyzshop.com|xyzshop.com>, will it still successfully tie the <http://xyz.com|xyz.com> shop behavior to that contact in HubSpot?
Hey, <@UBQSVT1HA>. To help me investigate further, could you share your Hub ID, an example request URL (with the `hapikey` removed), example payload, and full response?

Hey, <@UF6M5BW4C>. At this time, advanced menus are not accessible via API. They can be cloned in-app, however, per this feature request (<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Ability-to-clone-advanced-menus/idi-p/11183>).

I couldn’t find an existing idea post on an Advanced Menus API. Would you mind posting one? If you share it here, I would be happy to upvote it.

Hey, <@ULCT87EPK>. Yes, if you have the HubSpot tracking code installed (<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/reports/install-the-HubSpot-tracking-code>) on both sites and:
• You pass their `email` value through the `identify` function (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/tracking_code_api/identify_visitor>) on _*both*_ domains _OR_
• You have *automatic cross-domain linking* enabled (<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/reports/set-up-sources-tracking>) and you pass their `email` value *and* `HubSpotutk` cookie through either a HubSpot form (or Forms API-integrated form) or the `identify` function on the second domain, <http://xyzshop.com|xyzshop.com>.

Sorry, I should have been clearer. That channel is not the official way to submit ideas. Please post on the HubSpot Community Ideas Forum: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/custom/page/page-id/ideaslandingpage>.
